oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with Vince Gill - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Vince Gill (performer) for On the Record with Ralph Emery. Recording is performed in front of a live audience. Interview features a segment featuring Jerene Gill (personality) and Chet Atkins (performer). Recording is from May 31, 1994. Tape is labeled par 1.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Vince Gill; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Vince Gill, Jerene Gill and Ralph Emery joke about a golfing photo featuring Vince; additionally, Emery expresses his thanks for Jerene Gill -- (02:29) Emery invites Vince to reflect on his European tour, and Emery inquires about European food -- (06:39) Emery presents a shirt to Vince, and both discuss Vince's first band -- (08:10) Vince reflects on a time where a tornado struck during the Spring Fever Bluegrass Festival -- (08:53) Butterfield's and Mountain Smoke's relationship to Kiss is reflected upon -- (13:05) Emery inquires as to why Vince moved out to California in the 1970s -- (13:40) Emery invites Vince to remember the instance where he met Rodney Crowell -- (14:29) Emery plays a clip where Crowell recalls when he watched Vince perform -- (15:02) Emery and Vince discuss Vince's time working with Crowell -- (15:25) Emery and Vince reflect on how Vince got a job with the Pure Prairie League by accident -- (17:50) Emery asks Vince about his marriage to Jenny; additionally, both joke about Jenny's musical aspirations -- (21:58) Emery and Vince discuss how Vince chose a talent show over the Grand Ole Opry -- (22:47) Emery complements Vince; additionally, Emery introduces Vince's desire to be a great song-writer -- (24:44) Emery plays a tape of a Vince acceptance speech honoring Jenny -- (25:23) Emery inquires as to why Vince decided to honor Jenny -- (26:29) Emery and Vince discuss when Vince moved to Nashville, and both reflect on Tony Brown signing Vince to RCA and MCA -- (29:24) Emery introduces Vince's successful session-musician career -- (31:29) Emery invites Vince to tell a story about Roy Acuff enjoying "When I Call Your Name;" additionally, Emery introduces a video of Acuff inducting Gill into the Grand Ole Opry -- (33:28) When I Call Your Name (Vince Gill) -- (34:23) Vince and Emery joke about how Acuff had poor eye sight -- (35:14) Emery recalls a salute to Minnie Pearl, and Emery invites Vince to remember a story about Elvis Presley -- (36:32) Emery inquires how Vince got robbed on a golf trip with the Belmont basketball players -- (39:21) Emery introduces "Rhythm, Country and Blues;" additionally, Emery introduces Gladys Knight to reflect on the work she and Vince performed on "Ain't Nothing Like the Real Thing" -- (43:17) Emery inquires about Knight's current scheduling -- (44:20) Emery and Vince praise Knight; additionally, Emery inquires about what Vince meant when he explained the difference of Country and blues -- (45:43) Emery invites Vince to reflect on the perception of the audience base behind the "Rhythm, Country, and Blues" -- (46:43) Emery asks Vince to reflect on who he admires -- (47:05) Emery and Vince discuss Vince's family's musical talents; additionally, Emery invites Vince to reflect on how he idolized Chet Atkins -- (48:09) Atkins is invited by Emery to perform with Vince after a commercial break -- (49:00) Emery invites Atkins to greet the crowd and reflect on the first song of Vince's he heard -- (50:29) Emery and Atkins joke about Vince -- (51:19) Going Down That Road Feeling Bad (Chet Atkins and Vince Gill) -- (53:05) Emery and Atkins praise Vince and "South Side of Dixie;" additionally, Atkins presents Gill with a guitar -- (56:32) Emery inquires as to if Vince had ever given away a guitar; plus, Vince reflects on receiving the Country Music Association's Entertainer of the Year Award -- (58:43) Emery praises Vince's charitable contributions -- (59:46) Emery plays a clip where Vince wins the Minnie Pearl Award -- (1:01:55) Emery invites Vince to discuss how Vince and Jenny joke about each other in their songs -- (1:03:51) Emery plays a clip where Vince is awarded the Country Music Association's Entertainer of the Year Award
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Gill, Vince; Atkins, Chet;
